definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair

sentences.english: In fact, the world of friendship there are jealous, that nothing less than love.
sentences.chinese: 其实，友情世界里也存在着吃醋，那滋味不亚于爱情。

sentences.english: How would you protect yourself from a jealous lover?
Will not be jealous with each other before we can really their advantage.
sentences.chinese: 彼此不会吃醋，才可以真的无所不谈。

sentences.english: She is just using him to make her old boyfriend jealous.
sentences.chinese: 她只不过是在利用他来使她从前的男友吃醋。

sentences.english: Two guys tried to beat each other's time around the woman.
sentences.chinese: 有两个家伙围绕着这个女人竞相角逐，争风吃醋。

sentences.english: If you're jealous, she says it's bad.
It sounds like you are jealous.
The man to likes the woman who is jealous, is more than discontentedly likes.
sentences.chinese: 男人对喜欢吃醋的女人，不满多于喜欢。

sentences.english: 3Do you think that the sourest feeling is to be jealous?

sentences.english: Atrophic gastritis can be jealous of ginger soak it?

sentences.english: Rachel and I aren’t really very jealous...

sentences.english: Shanxi jealous love of good brew, known as "old acyl children, " said.
sentences.chinese: 山西人善酿酷爱吃醋，素有“老醯儿”之称。

sentences.english: When you narrow-minded to envy want jealous.
sentences.chinese: 当你小心眼的想要妒忌想要吃醋了。

sentences.english: He realized he was jealous of her new boyfriend.

definition: vinegar jar/(fig.) person of a jealous nature
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with

change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
